result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Savaria E Gilbert

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Savaria E Gilbert appeared by video.  Attorney Travis Schwantes appeared by video for Savaria E Gilbert.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11/9/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Admission of 911 Recordings
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Savaria E Gilbert in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Savaria E Gilbert in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: Officer Justino Rodriguez (MPD). State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Savaria E Gilbert in court with attorney Travis Schwantes appearing as a friend of the Court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for hearing. Attorney Schwantes will be appointed to this case. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR.35
Defendant Savaria E Gilbert in court, appear in person.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with ALT.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Savaria E Gilbert in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Savaria E Gilbert in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
